intro: Rudgea spicata, commonly known as the spicate rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rudgea spicata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodland areas.
